translated: Through that mere rejoicing of mine,ğŸ”½I obtained a mansion of wondrous beauty;
Sixteen leagues all around,
I go through the air by my psychic power.
My dwelling has gabled chambers,
divided into sections, well-proportioned;
Shining all around,
for a thousand leagues.
And here are my lotus-ponds,
frequented by bees;
With clear water, well-covered,
with golden sand spread over the bottom.
Filled with various lotuses,
with white lotuses in bloom;
Fragrant breezes blow from them,
gentle, with the sound of bees.
Rose-apple trees, breadfruit trees, date-palm trees,
and groves of coconut trees;
In the inner quarters they were born,
various trees were planted.
With the sound of various musical instruments,
with the sound of the scattering of pearl necklaces;
Even one who sees me in a dream
will be a wealthy man.
Such is this wondrously beautiful mansion,
all shining;
I was born through my own deeds,
It is enough to do meritorious deeds.â€
